page.title: 11HOUSING
page.content: Housing in the area is very mixed. After Warrington was designated a new town in the late sixties, many new estates sprang up on the outskirts of the old Warrington Borough. These estates include private owner_occupied and rented accommodation ranging from single person flats, semi_detached houses to luxury detached family homes. Also included in this block are large areas of post_war council houses, many of which have been purchased by the tenants, small private estates of houses formerly belonging to the Admiralty, and an estate built in 1978 by the Sutton Housing Trust on land which formed part of the site of the old Padgate R.A.F. Camp which closed in 1957 after more than a million RAF recruits had done their basic training there. The Camp is remembered with affection.
